title: Basic Usage
content: Basic usage of the ActionMenu component.

title: Disabled
content: Use the disabled field to configure whether the current drop-down list box is disabled.

title: Display Text
content: Use the text-field attribute to configure the key value of the text to be displayed. The default value is label.

title: The text of the drop-down button is displayed.
content: Use the attribute more-text to configure the text to be displayed in the drop-down list box. The default value is More

title: Spacing
content: The spacing attribute is used to configure the spacing between menu buttons. The default value is 5px.

title: Customize drop-down panel style
content: Set the class name and style of the drop-down panel through the popper-class attribute.

title: Displayed Number
content: The max-show-num attribute specifies the maximum number of displayed menu buttons. The default value is 2

title: Menu Item Click Event
content: When a menu item is selected, the item-click event is triggered. The transferred parameter is the data of the selected item.

title: More button click event
content: The more-click event is triggered when a drop-down list button is clicked.

title: Menu Slot
content: Use #item to configure the template for the options in the drop-down list box.

title: Drop-down menu visible change
content: When the drop-down menu change to be visible or hidden, the visible-change event is triggered.
